basics.name: Sebastian Gaete
basics.summary: Recently graduated, multidisciplinary Software Engineer with excellent problem solving abilities and process-thinking skill seeks hands on experience within a company that embraces creativity and innovation.

education.studyType: Master of Science in Computer Science

education.institution: École Centrale de Lille at France
education.studyType: Dual Degree with Master of Engineering, Major in Applied Mathematics
Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Civil Engineering, Major in Information Technologies

work.name: Latam Cargo
work.position: Network and Operations Senior Analyst, Strategic Planning
highlights: Developed and executed Python-based solutions to adhere to crew regulations and optimize crew shift distribution.
Constructed and implemented datasets to support SQL queries, resulted in a 10% increase of the fleet utilization.
Implemented data-driven forecasting for unscheduled maintenance failures in the cargo fleet, achieving a 7% reduction in maintenance hours thanks to preventive maintenance measures.

work.name: Latam Airlines
highlights: Ranked 1st among procurement and finance analysts.
Designed and executed a fuel import project in Brazil, which is the company’s largest market. The initiative resulted in savings of $55M USD for LATAM and $165M for the Brazilian jet fuel industry.
Developed fuel optimization models for flight routes, saving $10M and significant reductions in CO2 emissions.

work.name: Decathlon
highlights: Led the implementation and execution of MEGA software (Managing Enterprise Complexity) that was used to model the company's structure.

skills.name: Programming Knowledge
keywords: Python | C++ | C | Debugger Use (gdb) | Java | TypeScript | OpenGL | SQL | Linux (kernel/user mode) and Unix shell | R | VBA | Open Source (GitHub/ GitLab).

projects.name: Ray Tracer
projects.summary: Performed a Ray-Tracer algorithm in C++ with ray-object collision detection by using BVH.

projects.name: Implementation of a Thread Scheduling System with Priority Levels
projects.summary: Developed a the system considering priority levels for each thread. Constructed a simplified Linux kernel and user mode to integrate with the scheduling.

projects.name: Black-Box Adversarial Attacks against Models of Code
projects.summary: Implemented and analyzed a generalizable black-box attack agains models of code

projects.name: Frequency Based Histogram Query Optimizer
projects.summary: Executed a Frequency Based Histogram Query Optimizer for Efficient Join Order Selection.

projects.name: Procedural walking simulator inspired by Minecraft
projects.summary: Developed CPU-based terrain generation and GPU-accelerated procedural texture synthesis utilizing Perlin noise, introduced fractal trees using L-systems and multi-octave value noise.

projects.name: Speech-to-Speech Translation (S2ST): A Survey
projects.summary: A paper focused on the task of S2ST. Centered on direct, text-less and multilingual S2ST.

projects.name: Group Membership Management Protocols
projects.summary: Studied these protocols in fault-tolerant distributed systems: synchronous, asynchronous and hybrids.

projects.name: Graduate Research, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile
projects.summary: Assessed the innovation and barriers of Chilean SMEs using data from Chile’s national surveys.

projects.name: Research Assistance, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile
projects.summary: Designed an entrepreneurship index following the OECD standards for ASELA.

projects.name: Undergraduate Research, Ecole Centrale de Lille at France
projects.summary: Implemented solutions through linear programming to optimize the scheduling of train conductors at SNCF.

volunteer.summary: Teaching Assistant for Introduction to Programming, Linear Algebra, Calculus III, Marketing and Time Series.

volunteer.position: President of University International Students Association.
